items.sentence: Tom compared a picture taken of Mary three years ago with one that had been taken recently.
When Tom looked down at the apple he was eating, he realized that he had eaten half a worm.
Tom got some money from Mary and went to the supermarket to buy what she wanted him to buy.
Tom began working as a volunteer at the homeless shelter while he was still in high school.
Tom ate at a new restaurant the other day, but he doesn\'t remember the restaurant\'s name.
Even though Tom translated the letter for Mary, she didn\'t bother to read his translation.
If you want to really improve your French, you should move to a country where it\'s spoken.
It took me three trips to the supermarket to buy everything we needed for tonight\'s party.
Tom has lived in Boston for thirty years, but he still doesn\'t seem to know the city well.
I know some of you want to go back to the way things were, but that\'s not going to happen.
